required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Linagliptin in Type-2-diabetes Mellitus Patients With Moderate to Severe Renal Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Parallel Group Safety and Efficacy Study of Linagliptin (5 mg Administered Orally Once Daily) Over 12 Weeks Followed by a 40 Week Double-blind Extension Period (Placebo Patients Switched to Glimepiride) in Drug Naive or Previously Treated Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Moderate to Severe Renal Impairment and Insufficient Glycaemic Control

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the current study is to investigate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of linagliptin (5 mg / once daily) compared to placebo given over 12 weeks in drug naive or previously treated type 2 diabetic patients with moderate to severe renal impairment and insufficient glycaemic control. In addition safety in this patient population with longer term (40 week) treatment in comparison to sulfonylurea drug (glimepiride).

primary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 12
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c, renal function impairment and prior use of antidiabetic agents.

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 4, week 8, week 12, week 16, week 20, week 24, week 28, week 34, week 40, week 46, week 52
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the HbA1c percent over time minus the baseline HbA1c percent. This outcome measure only provides descriptive statistics without any modelling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) Change From Baseline to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Means are treatment-adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG and prior use of insulin, week repeated within patient and week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) Change From Baseline Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 4, week 8, week 12, week 20, week 24, week 28, week 34, week 40, week 46, week 52
secondary_outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the FPG over time minus the baseline FPG. This outcome measure only provides descriptive statistics without any modelling.

The percentage of patients with an HbA1c value below 7% at week 12 and week 52 were calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 12 or 52 respectively, they were considered a failure, so HbA1c above 7%.

The percentage of patients with an HbA1c value below 6.5% at week 12 and week 52 was calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 12 or 52 respectively they were considered a failure, so HbA1c above 6.5%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Have a HbA1c Lowering by at Least 0.5%
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients with an HbA1c reduction of â‰¥0.5% at week 12 and week 52 from baseline was calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 12 or 52 respectively they were considered a failure, so HbA1c reduction less than 0.5%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Linagliptin at Trough
secondary_outcome.description: Trough levels of concentration of Linagliptin in plasma.

arm_group.description: Placebo patients switch to glimepiride after 12 weeks (40 weeks treatment)

intervention.description: Placebo mach to 5 mg linagliptin first 12 weeks of treatment once daily
Placebo maching Glimepiride 1-4 mg after 12 weeks of treatment
Placebo mach to 5 mg linagliptin once daily after 12 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Type 2 diabetes mellitus
2. GFR<60 ml/min
3. HbA1c >=7.0% to <= 10%
4. Age >= 18 years
5. BMI <=45 kg/m2
6. Signed and dated written informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
1. Myocardial infarction, stroke or TIA within 3 months prior to informed consent
2. Renal impairment requiring dialysis
3. Bariatric surgery
4. Impaired hepatic function
5. Treatment with glitazones, GLP-1 analogues, DPP-4 inhibitors
6. Treatment with anti-obesity drugs
7. Treatment with SU, glinides and metformin 8 weeks prior to informed consent

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 241 patients were randomised to treatment with linagliptin 5mg (n=118) or placebo/glimepiride (n=123). All randomised patients were treated. For the final analysis, one study site was excluded due to serious non-compliance resulting in 122 patients in the placebo/glimepiride group and 113 patients in the linagliptin group.

group.title: Placebo/Glimepiride
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo for 12 weeks and then switch to glimepiride for further 40 weeks.

group.title: Linagliptin 5 mg
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with Linagliptin 5mg

group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo for 12 weeks and then switch to glimepiride for further 40 weeks.

group.title: Linagliptin 5 mg
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with Linagliptin 5mg

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.description: Age Continuous for patient set up to 52 weeks

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Age Continuous for patient set up to 12 weeks (N=123, 118, 241)

measure.description: Gender for patient set up to 12 weeks (N=123, 118, 241)

measure.description: BMI for patient set up to 52 weeks.

measure.title: Body mass index (BMI) continuous
measure.description: BMI for patient set up to 12 weeks (N=123, 118, 241)

measure.title: Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1 (HbA1c)
measure.description: HbA1c based on Full analysis set (FAS) up to 52 weeks (N=120, 113, 233)

measure.title: Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1 (HbA1c)
measure.description: HbA1c based on Full analysis set (FAS) up to 12 weeks (N=121, 117, 238)

measure.title: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
measure.description: FPG based on Full analysis set (FAS) up to 52 weeks (N=120, 113, 233)

measure.title: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
measure.description: FPG based on FAS up to 12 weeks (N=121, 117, 238)

measure.title: eGFR based on Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula
measure.description: eGFR based on FAS up to 52 weeks (N=122, 113, 235). eGFR means Estimated glomerular filtration rate.

measure.title: eGFR based on Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) formula
measure.description: eGFR based on FAS up to 12 weeks (N=123, 118, 241). eGFR means Estimated glomerular filtration rate.

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 12
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c, renal function impairment and prior use of antidiabetic agents.
outcome.population: FAS consisting of all randomised patients who were treated with at least one dose of study drug, had a baseline, and at least 1 on-treatment HbA1c measurement. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule. Results for primary endpoint below are the ones reproduced without patients from the excluded study site.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo for 12 weeks and then switch to glimepiride for further 40 weeks.

group.title: Linagliptin 5 mg
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with Linagliptin 5mg

measure.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 12
measure.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c, renal function impairment and prior use of antidiabetic agents.
measure.population: FAS consisting of all randomised patients who were treated with at least one dose of study drug, had a baseline, and at least 1 on-treatment HbA1c measurement. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule. Results for primary endpoint below are the ones reproduced without patients from the excluded study site.

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline Over Time
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the HbA1c percent over time minus the baseline HbA1c percent. This outcome measure only provides descriptive statistics without any modelling.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, week 4, week 8, week 12, week 16, week 20, week 24, week 28, week 34, week 40, week 46, week 52
outcome.population: FAS. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule. Results do not contain data of patients from the excluded study site.

measure.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline Over Time
measure.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the HbA1c percent over time minus the baseline HbA1c percent. This outcome measure only provides descriptive statistics without any modelling.
measure.population: FAS. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule. Results do not contain data of patients from the excluded study site.

outcome.title: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) Change From Baseline to Week 12
outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Means are treatment-adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG and prior use of insulin, week repeated within patient and week by treatment interaction.
outcome.population: One patient in the Placebo/Glimepiride arm and one patient in the Linagliptin arm without FPG on-treatment value. Results do not contain data of patients from the excluded study site.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c <7.0%
outcome.description: The percentage of patients with an HbA1c value below 7% at week 12 and week 52 were calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 12 or 52 respectively, they were considered a failure, so HbA1c above 7%.
outcome.population: FAS with baseline HbA1c >=7% and non-completers considered as failure imputation (NCF). Results after Week 12 include patients from the excluded study site.

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of Linagliptin at Trough
outcome.description: Trough levels of concentration of Linagliptin in plasma.
outcome.population: FAS original results (OR). Original results analysis means that data is analyzed exactly as observed, values after rescue medication are not set to missing and no imputation rule is applied for replacing the missing values.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
